:::{layout-ncol=2 layout-valign="top"}

:::{.left width="60%"}

I work mainly on emerging sampling algorithms, such as Piecewise Deterministic Monte Carlo methods and Denoising Diffusion Models, supervised by <a href="https://sites.google.com/view/kengokamatani/home">Kengo Kamatani</a>.

Before pursuing a Ph.D. in Statistics, I studied Mathematics at the University of Tokyo.

:::

# Research Interests

1. Monte Carlo methods, e.g., MCMC, SMC, & PDMP
2. Diffusion Models, Neural Networks, & Kernel Methods
3. Bayesian Statistical Modelling, especially in Political Science & Biostatistics

# [Software](static/Software.qmd)

I maintain the Julia package [PDMPFlux.jl](https://github.com/162348/PDMPFlux.jl), and also contribute to the R package [YUIMA](https://github.com/yuimaproject/yuima).
